summary:
**Meeting Overview**:  
The Board of Adjustment (Panel C) of the City of Dallas will convene for a briefing at 10:00 A.M. followed by a public hearing at 1:00 P.M. on August 19, 2024, at Dallas City Hall. The purpose of the meeting is to discuss various zoning cases, including special exceptions and variances related to property regulations.

**Key Agenda Items**:  
The meeting will include a staff presentation, public testimony, and a review of the case docket, which consists of uncontested items, holdover items, and individual cases requiring decisions.

**Important Details**:  
Significant proposals on the agenda include requests for special exceptions to landscaping, fence height, visibility obstruction, and parking regulations. Notable cases include:
- BDA234-084(CJ): Landscaping exception at 2626 W. Mockingbird Lane.
- BDA234-085(BT): Multiple exceptions regarding fence height and visibility at 402 S. Beacon Street.
- BDA234-087(BT): Exception and variance requests for single-family and floor area regulations at 8703 Angora Street.
- BDA234-091(CJ): Parking regulation exception at 1444 Oak Lawn Avenue.

**Action Items**:  
The Board will seek approvals for the proposed exceptions and variances listed in the case docket. Additionally, the minutes from the previous meeting on June 17, 2024, will be reviewed for approval. Public participation is encouraged, with registration required for those wishing to speak.
